title: Can We Extrapolate?
question_text:
A statistics student wanted to do a study by examining data from last year's baseball season. He wanted to randomly select $40$ players and note their weight and the number of home runs they hit. The student wanted to see if weighing more might predict more home runs being hit.
Of the $40$ players, the weights ranged from $180$ to $280$ pounds. He obtained a regression equation of $\hat{y}=-60+0.4x$. The student wondered if it was reasonable to predict the number of home runs hit by a $300$ pound man and by a $400$ pound man.
Which answer below seems most reasonable?

choices.text: No. Predicting beyond the range of values for the explanatory variable is never reasonable.
Yes. Predicting beyond the range of values for the explanatory variable is always reasonable.

Yes. These predictions are not always reasonable, but in this case they might be as the 400
pound man could be very tall and very strong.
No. These predictions are unreasonable simply because the home run numbers are too high.

Yes and No. It is reasonable to predict for the 300
pound man since that weight is very close to the others, but to predict as far away as 400
pounds is not reasonable.

solution:
Solution

This question about linear regression is all about extrapolation. Extrapolation means predicting values beyond the range of input values on which the regression model is based. The farther away from that range of values, the less reliable the prediction becomes.

In this example, 300
pounds is very close the the high of 280
pounds. Using the model this would result in a a prediction of 60
home runs hit, not a common amount but it has been done. However, 400
pounds is much farther away from the range of input values for the explanatory variable. It would result in a prediction of 100
home runs which has never been done. Therefore, predicting for 300
pounds is reasonable, but much higher than that is not.

So, Choice 'E' is correct.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect because this is simply untrue. There are times when extrapolation makes a lot of sense.

Choice 'B' is incorrect because this is simply untrue. There are times when it is reasonable and there are times when it is not.

Choice 'C' is incorrect because, while a
400
pound man may be tall and strong, it is still unlikely that he will hit
100
home runs. The number is just too high and this answer does not make it reasonable.

Choice 'D' is incorrect because, while the
100
number is too high, hitting
60
home runs is not. Still, the decision on whether to extrapolate should be made on how close the numbers are to the original range used in creating the model.
